title.narrative: Emergency drought response through provision of integrated water, sanitation and hygiene promotion (WASH) services in Somalia

description.narrative: The overall objective of this project is to save the lives of drought-affected communities in Somalia by providing access to clean water, sanitation, and hygiene services in Kahda and Daynile districts in the Baanadir region and Xudur and Wajid districts in the Bakool region. Under this project, IOM provides lifesaving water, rehabilitation, and construction of boreholes, construction of household latrines, and distribution of hygiene kits. The project provides humanitarian assistance to 80,000 people, including 16,000 women, 12,000 men, 52,000 children, and 1,500 persons with disabilities.
